name: Lily Pond Country Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed three nights at Lily Pond Country Lodge. Our luxury room was situated opposite the reception rooms in a beautiful setting overlooking the lily ponds and the forest. The baboons that ventured into the gardens were soon chased off by a very vigilant guard dog! The staff and food were excellent and the spa is well worth a visit.
reviews.title: Beautiful Gardens

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An excellent place to stay for visiting The Crags and Plettenburg Bay.
reviews.title: Nice quiet country house for a decent price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We came here more or less by coincidence, but were very pleasantly surprised. The rooms are very spacious, there is a nice private patio with a beautiful look at the pond and the forest with baboons. It is much better than having a room in a Plettenberg guesthouse, because of the space and freedom, and the quiet nights, while everything you want to visit is still very nearby, including a beautiful beach. Dinner has a set menu, but it is delicious and prices not very high. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Lovely Serene Elegant Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived and settled into our room with balcony doors that opened overlooking the Lily Pond. Very quiet and serene setting in large grounds. Nice pool with comfortable loungers, towels provided. Hotel owners were very nice and made us welcome. The resturant had a set menu in the evenings but if there was anything you didn't like an alternative was offered. The chef served up some delicious food. The condition and fttings of the hotel were beautiful and everything was potlessly clean. Just a short drive to the beautiful long almost deserted sandy beach. We would certainly hope to return to this hotel. Thank you for a most enjoyable stay!
reviews.title: An oasis in Plet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The photos on Lily Pond's website don't do it justice: this really is a glorious place to relax before or after heading off in search of the 'Big 5'. The rooms are loosely arranged around the eponymous lily pond, four of which are garden suites and a bit away from the main building. These are really spacious, with a divider between the bedroom/sitting area and large bathroom, which also has an outside shower. The bed was king size with oversized pillows, although more conventional pillows are available. No air-con is provided although there is a ceiling fan which just about stops nights from becoming too stuffy. The garden suites suffer a bit in terms of privacy from having a path in front of them and sounds from the next door suite are rather too audible at times. Food is uniformly excellent: from a generous buffet-style, continental breakfast with cooked options to a four-course dinner at R225 per head, although this is rather regimented with everyone starting courses at the same time. Free WiFi is available although the connection wasn't very reliable in our garden room. Staff are terrific and clearly well trained. All in all, strongly recommended.
reviews.title: Total relaxation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Lily Pond Country Lodge is a very nice place to stay and you really feel like you are in a beautiful spot of nature but my one big issue was the price of everything.
reviews.title: Nice but overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I know their target client is Europeans and it seems like they up their prices thinking that Europeans won't realize it's expensive but it is for South African standards and they are making a tremendous profit. I live in South Africa but am American so I can see that for the American and European currency it isn't breaking the bank account for 4 star accommodation but living in South Africa I know how much things are actually worth. And I don't mind paying extra if you get what you are paying for but there is no air conditioning, the heater in the room takes a couple hours to heat up (we had one cold day there and one hot day strangely enough), they don't provide shampoo or conditioner, they give a soap for the sink but then have a liquid soap contraption by the shower which reminds me of going to a public bathroom, the beds are really hard and the pillows were incredibly uncomfortable...and that is something I am not finicky about. The towels and bath gown were also quite hard and can feel they need fabric softener or a better quality detergent. Also, they say they have internet in the rooms but it didn't work in my room...they then gave me some gadget to hook up to my laptop which didn't work bc the last client accidentally kept the disc. The rooms were tidy but mine had a slight musky smell but my travel companions did not although she wasn't very happy with the cleanliness of the room. The rooms are clean and definitely get mopped and washed and everything but you can see they don't get a good scrub often enough.
reviews.title: Relaxing environment with unobtrusive service of a very high order.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They do provide a very nice breakfast...I wish though that since its such a small place with few clients they wouldn't give such a small window for breakfast hours.
reviews.title: A little bit of heaven in the well named Natures Valley

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had dinner there one night and it was delicious. Once again...way over priced. I knew it wasn't going to be a la carte but I definitely didn't know no choice would be provided. Normally you can choose between two or three starters, main meals and desserts, here there is no choice at all. I think since this is the case they should ask you before hand if you have any dietary requirements. I for example do not eat fish and am allergic to peppers. Our meal for the night had salmon and luckily I got them to make me something else because I looked at the menu when I arrived...so it was great that they were able to change it for me but not everyone is going to love venison carpaccio (which is on their lunch menu...the other replacement choice was a Greek Salad or a Babotie tart). I think for the price they should have options and if not then they should inform you ahead of time so they can do a proper replacement for the more picky eater. Out of interest I looked at the dinner for the other 2 nights I was there and felt lucky to have eaten the first night because I wasn't loving what was on the menu. But as I said to begin with...it was delicious.
reviews.title: stunning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I know this review sounds kind of negative but just want people to know what to expect. The positive notes on this place is that it really is in a beautiful location and there is a lot to do within an hour radius. The staff is also really nice and the one manager I met was really friendly as well. I just don't like it when in Africa they raise the price of things to European or American standards...it makes me feel like they are trying to rip off their guests or pull the wool over their eyes. This isn't America and this isn't Europe...therefore you can't charge as if you are located there.
reviews.title: Stunning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here as part of our honeymoon along the Garden Route. It was absolutely beautiful. We had a deluxe room which had an amazing bathroom with jacuzzi bat and outdoor shower. The surroundings are lush (with the occasional baboon!) and the meals are exquisite. Everything is so tasteful and the staff are friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Very Romantic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From here, we visited the Plettenberg Elephant Sanctuary, Monkey Land and the Birds of Eden.
reviews.title: Wonderful!!!
Exceeded Our Expectations
reviews.text: Our photos can be found at

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: www.vic-tim.com
reviews.title: Wonderful experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Vicky and Tim Sadler, Manchester
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay. Tranquil.

likes.disliked: — The insects were very loud at night!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is like a little piece of heaven. Natures Valley is one of the most beautiful places in the world and feels like it is a million miles from civilisation yet is minutes from everywhere. The food, service and room were excellent. Would have loved to have stayed longer.
reviews.title: heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like mentioned by the other reviews .
reviews.title: Perfect if you like class. Perfect to relax , chill out and enjoy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Lily pond is class, in every single detail.
reviews.title: Hard to fault; perfect honeymoon destination....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff / colleagues are world class.
reviews.title: Good value and very relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Every hotel/resturant would love someone like Faith.
reviews.title: One of our best accommodations in South Africa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Last year my husband and I visited Lily Pond for the 6th time. A few years ago Lilypond was recommended to us by people we met in Santa Barbara, California. All our visits were fantastic and we have already planned our next visit. Niels and Margaret are excellent hosts and the staff is friendly, competent and very helpful.
reviews.title: Best place to be
Lovely property
reviews.text: So far we have tried a different room every time. It was an experience to stay in a large beautiful luxury suite. During our last visit we stayed in one of the smaller standard rooms, I liked the furnishing (colours) and the cosiness of this room. Also the view from our patio was wonderful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food is delicious and the atmosphere in the dining room is very relaxing. Although we've seen the environment many times now, we can't get enough of it. We like visiting the Birds of Eden, it's only a 10 minutes drive, it's a wonderful place to go for a walk. The beaches in Natures Valley and at Keurboomstrand are very quiet and it's nice to stay there for a while.
reviews.title: ideal to relax in a tranquil landscape with plenty of actiuvities close by

likes.disliked: — the small room and the cool atmoshpere in the dinning area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want to see game, go to Buffalo Hill or Rhino Base Camp it's worthwhile. We recommend Lily Pond to all our friends!
reviews.title: Erratic

likes.liked: — the lily pond itself (i.e. property grounds), food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This year my friend and I stayed at Lily Pond for the third time in four years, we always make sure we book in time! The hearty welcome by Niels and Margret and the fine food (both for breakfast and dinner) make us return every time we visit ZA. Also the staff are really friendly and efficient. The lodge is located at a 10 minute’s drive from the beautiful beach and lagoon of Nature’s Valley, and close to Tsitsikamma National Park where we went for the tree top tour and hiked the first part of the Otter Trail. We still have not dared to do the Bungy Jump! In Knysna we went watching whales and dolphins, the whales kept some distance, but there were dozens of dolphins swimming and jumping along … Last year we visited the Elephant Sanctuary and rode on elephantback, quite and experience! On Keurbooms river we had a relaxing afternoon trip on a kind of “lounge boat”. The room we had at the lodge was great as always, with its private decking overlooking one of the ponds. Furthermore we enjoyed the jacuzzi next to one of the ponds after a safari on horseback in Rhino Base Camp and arranged for a very relaxing massage at the property. We will definitely return to this lovely place!
reviews.title: Beautiful Place!

likes.liked: — Beautiful grounds, beautiful rooms,great people working there.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I had a wonderful time at the Lily Pond Lodge. I personally didn't enjoy the cities very much in South Africa as they are just like any city in Europe or the States... including the malls. But this wonderful space is a little bit outside, tranquil - yes - but in the midst of nature. Because of the arrangement of the bungalows and units (only few, so you it feels truly personal) you have an undevided view on the pond and don't actually have to see any other guests. The dinners that you can book are very sweet and delightful, all with a twist. From there you can easily access all activities - either around the corner or in up to 150k. The Knysna Elephant Park is just 20min away, the Snake Sanctuary, often underrated, is just around the corner.. We made daytrips to Oudsthoorn, Knysna... I can only recommend it!!
reviews.title: Lovely, calm, sweet, welcoming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a spaciously designed lodge with a number of buildings alongside a large and beautiful pool full of waterlilies. The buildings are simple and, in a way, basic - but made attractive because the character is very contemporary, with dark russet and mushroom decor, and many thoughtful features. As we were attending a wedding nearby, I was grateful to find an iron and ironing board already in the room without having to ask for these to be brought. Our room was divided into three areas, with a small sitting room overlooking the pond and leading to a private deck outside, a spacious sleeping area with a large, firm bed, and then a semi-incorporated bathroom (though with a private loo). We were only able to stay one night but we could have enjoyed a longer stay.
reviews.title: A relaxing, quiet place away from the stresses of Plett

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In most ways, I'd give this hotel 3 stars - I'd rate it as just adequate, as it just didn't quite have the polished, incredibly polite and comfortable edge which we found in the best hotels on our stay in South Africa.
reviews.title: Good, but just didn't quite ring true

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very small by SA standards, and decorated with pretensions of grandeur which didn't quite come off - wall decorations included a particularly terrifying mask in the toilet! Decor was like that throughout the hotel - it was trying to be elegant and individual, but ended up seeming a combination of chilly in its minimalism, and bizarre in its design touches. All rooms have one glass wall looking out over the gardens, which is very pretty but, as other reviewers have pointed out, very problematic in terms of privacy. The bathroom was tiny, with the shower over the bath - one of the only places we went to where it wasn't separate.
reviews.title: Great Honeymoon stay near Tsitsikamma

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The location is pretty poor - there's very little anywhere nearby, and getting dinner anywhere decent outside the hotel would have meant a 20 minute drive. The gardens were beautiful, though, and watching the sun set over the lily ponds was quite an experience.
reviews.title: Beautiful and peaceful. And bacon.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is, undoubtedly, gorgeous. The grounds are immaculate and beautiful. The rooms lovely to behold. Unfortunately, this is an inn, not a work of art.
reviews.title: A triumph of style over substance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived on a warm evening, only to find that the ceiling fan in our room was not functioning properly. I asked the staff to contact the owner (who was not present). He didn't even bother to come to the room. He told the staff member to tell me, "That's just the way the fan is." The rooms have very small windows so, in order to get any of the cool evening air we were forced to leave our sliding glass doors wide open all night. Oh, yes, the sliding glass doors. One complete wall in the bedroom was glass doors which opened onto the grounds of the hotel. There weren't many people walking by, but there were some. So it was impossible to have both light and privacy in the room at the same time.
reviews.title: Lovely place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the only hotel/inn/guest house where we have stayed in South Africa that charges its guests for Internet use. And it wasn't cheap. Two hours of wireless Internet access costs R50 (about $5). It really seemed stingy, especially in light of the fact that to stay at this place is pretty expensive by South African standards.
reviews.title: Pretty nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009
reviews.text: Finally, the restaurant. Perhaps unfortunately for this restaurant, we had just come from Franschhoek, where we had incredible meals at bargain (by U. S. standards) prices. This restaurant suffered terribly in comparison. The dinner we here was about 70% as good as the best meal we had in Franschhoek and cost about 110% as much.
reviews.title: Really Great Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't recommend Lily Pond Inn, either as a place to stay or as a restaurant.
reviews.title: Spectacular hideaway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The smaller rooms, although not large, are comfortable and more than adequate for a night or two, but if you are staying longer you may prefer to go for a suite. The Lodge provides evening meals – a very necessary option since it is in a fairly remote location with no practical alternative to “eating in” being available: although the food was excellent, note that it was a set menu with no choice when we were there. The layout of the dining room made us feel isolated with little chance to talk to other guests – you may feel that is a good thing, but we thought it a bit sad.
reviews.title: Comfortable Place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a thoroughly enjoyable two-night stay at Lily Pond Lodge. The hotel is perfectly located, just a few minutes drive from Nature's Valley (watch out for the baboons as you drive down!) and half an hour from Storm's River Mouth. Our room was open plan, with two terraces, an outdoor rain shower and a jacuzzi bathtub. The setting is second to none. The infinity pool is freezing but thoroughly refreshing. We found the hotel's owners to be incredibly friendly, and full of useful tips. The food in the restaurant is limited to a setr menu with one choice for each course, but this never bothered us as the food was of such a high quality. This was the best place we stayed along the Garden Route.
reviews.title: Wonderful little place, superb food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent two nights in Lily Pond in the luxury rooms. We didn't see the standard rooms, but the luxury rooms are just wonderful. Great feeling, the open bathroom (the toilet is separate and closed off though). Toiletteries are great. The atmosphere in the restaurant is great, breakfast is wonderful. Dinner is really really nice. Lily Pond is quietly situated in the Natures Valley, easy to find and easy to reach. It is a great stop only half an hour from Plettenberg Bay. If you really need to chill out, I suggest you stay a week.
reviews.title: lovely place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: I have to say that when it comes to the Garden Route I sometimes cringe as I know there is such a mixture of fly by nights and class all mixed into one pot. What I experienecd at Lily Pond Lodge was warm staff, beautiful accomodation in a truly peaceful and beautiful surroundings with loads and loads to do in the area. The food was of an outstanding quality and the service from all staff tremeandous and as a single traveller I am well aware of how sometimes staff can feel uncomfortable about how best to deal with you. I was joined for dinner by the owner Margret and her friend from the Netherlands which turned out to be one of the highlights of my trip down the Garden Route. The rooms are spacious and has catered for every need before your even aware it is a need! A great spot well managed and just far enough off the beaten track to provide an idealic hideaway in the heart of the Natures valley area.
reviews.title: Little piece of heaven on the Garden route

likes.liked: — Views over the Pond from your bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Lily Pond had been recommended to us by another Portfolio member ([--]). Coming there, we liked the tranquil atmosphere of the pond garden and the cool design (Honeymoon Suite). Dinner and Breakfast is high-class, also. And it is a very good location to explore Tsitsikamma and especially Nature's Valley. We got extensive information for the sights every morning. Now, what is the disadvantage of Lily Pond? I must say that, compared to other similar places we have stayed at within our South Africa Trip, the dedication of the hosts to the guests is just not that warm. The hosts leave you the feeling that they like to draw a line between themselves and the guests. And we had one very dissatisfying experience, where we asked to be seated at the fireplace for dinner in the morning, and ended up to be placed near a windy door instead, while the owners with some friends were sitting at the fireplace. No excuses or even comments were made about it. But, all in all, not a bad location in the area.
reviews.title: Very nice Property - not always 100% dedicated to guests

description: Quietly situated amongst large colorful lily ponds and indigenous forests, Lily Pond is renowned for its design, tranquility, creative cuisine and relaxing ambiance. This contemporary "Afro-Zen" style Country Lodge is ideally situated to explore Tsitsikamma National Park and close to Nature's Valley beach and lagoon. Good food sets the scene and Margret's culinary skills are not to be missed. Large salt water pool & heated Jacuzzi. Dutch & German spoken
